Start an insanely profitable business in a semester. A step-by-step live course that will teach you how to find your first customer and generate revenue.

Let's do this!

Tired of just learning about business, but never building one?

Throughout this course you be will be DOING things, not just learning. We've broken it down into 3 steps.
1

Find a problem

There's a common myth that all businesses start as a "light-bulb" moment. Instantly the idea is magically turned into a giant billion dollar business overnight and everyone is swimming in money. Unfortunately that's not the case. Instead, you'll learn how to find niche markets, uncover problems that you never knew existed, and have them begging you to solve them.

2

Test the solution

Many new entrepreneurs spend months or even years building things without talking to a SINGLE customer. Does your solution solve their painful problem? If it does, will they pay for your solution? You'll learn how to answer these questions before spending tons of time and money.

3

Build the solution

This is where the rubber meets the road. You'll learn how to build the first version of your product as quickly and as cheap as possible with only the core features your customer needs. This is where you can start honing in what they need and don't need. Oh, and you don't need to know how to code.

All you need is a burning desire to learn.

You don't need any business/tech background, fancy suits, high IQ, or connections.

Who will be teaching?

I'm Jack Zerby, Founder of Flavors.me and Goodsie. Former Director of Design at Vimeo, and a designer at Pentagram, Frog, and RG/A.

My experience with startups began with being Design Director at Vimeo, building it from 250,000 users to over 15 million users today. I then co-founded two companies after leaving Vimeo, Flavors.me and Goodsie, and with my partners, have raised several million in capital from angel investors in NYC and Silicon Valley. We built Flavors to 750,000 users and recently sold it to Moo.com.

Both companies have been featured in the NY Times, Forbes, Entrepreneur Magazine, Fast Company, Time, and the Wall Street Journal.

After 10 years in NYC, my family and I moved to State College, PA to raise our 2 kiddos. (My wife and I grew up in Hollidaysburg, PA)

How much does it cost?

Every year, millions of college students sign up to spend over 150k on college courses which teach them great principles, but rarely actually teach them how to build a business. We believe this class is an invaluable addition to any college curriculum, and the combination will make you unstoppable.

Money was a HUGE issue for me in college, I had none. But if knew what I know now, I would've paid anything.

If you're not 100% happy after attending 2 classes, I will give you your money back, no questions asked.
